title: A Bioavailability Study of Four Experimental BMS-708163 Formulations Relative to Solubilized Capsule Formulation in Healthy Young Male Subjects
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to assess the bioavailability of four experimental formulations relative to the current reference formulation used in the Phase 2 study.
explanation_target: Reason: The investigational product named in the study title, BMS-708163 (avagacestat), is a small-molecule γ-secretase inhibitor developed to lower amyloid-β production (i.e., target Alzheimer’s pathology). citeturn0search0turn0search1

Act: The trial text describes a bioavailability/formulation study (four experimental formulations vs a solubilized capsule reference) in healthy young male subjects — a pharmacokinetic/formulation evaluation of the small-molecule drug BMS-708163. Formulation and PK work for BMS-708163 (including LC‑MS/MS methods and prodrug/formulation approaches) have been reported in the literature. citeturn0search3turn0search7

Reflect: Given the drug class (γ-secretase inhibitor) and mechanism (reduces Aβ peptide production), this intervention fits the definition of a disease-targeted small molecule rather than a biologic, cognitive enhancer, or neuropsychiatric symptom treatment. Clinical development (Phase 1/2) and biomarker effects (CSF Aβ reductions) have been reported for avagacestat, supporting that its intended effect is disease/pathology targeting. citeturn0search1turn0search6

Web search results (supporting citations): 1) Discovery and characterization of BMS-708163 as a potent, selective, orally bioavailable γ‑secretase inhibitor (ACS Med. Chem. Lett.). citeturn0search0 2) Single-dose study showing avagacestat (BMS‑708163) lowers CSF Aβ concentrations in healthy men (PubMed abstract). citeturn0search1 3) LC‑MS/MS methods and analytical work for measuring BMS‑708163 in plasma/CSF supporting PK/formulation studies. citeturn0search3 4) Phase 2 clinical data and safety/PD summaries for BMS‑708163 (reports summarizing Phase 2 findings and biomarker effects). citeturn0search6
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational drug BMS-708163 (avagacestat) is a potent, orally bioavailable γ‑secretase inhibitor developed to reduce production of amyloid‑β (Aβ) peptides — i.e., it directly targets the amyloid pathway of AD. citeturn0search0turn0search5

Act: The described study is a bioavailability/formulation (pharmacokinetic) evaluation of the small‑molecule BMS‑708163 in healthy young men; although the specific trial is PK/formulation-focused, the molecule’s mechanism of action (γ‑secretase inhibition → lower Aβ) defines the CADRO classification. citeturn0search2turn0search1

Reflect: Given the explicit mechanism (decreasing Aβ generation via γ‑secretase inhibition) the most specific CADRO match is A) Amyloid beta rather than other categories or multi‑target. (Clinical development and CSF Aβ pharmacodynamic effects have been reported for avagacestat, supporting this interpretation.) citeturn0search3turn0search5
